Posts.Content: chefstill wrote: Here's to all of the brave, wonderful, heroic, women before me..I hope I can be a trooper as well.  Twenty three years ago, I was diagnosed with breast cancer at a very early stage.  I had a mastectomy, but never had chemo or radiation.  Two months ago, I was diagnosed again.  I had another mastectomy, but this time my oncologist wants me to do chemo.  I have been researching and struggling and researching...and it's forums like this that have helped me decide to go forward with taxol and herceptin...I don't know if it's the right thing or not, but what can we do besides just walk away and take the risk that doing nothing will be okay?  I'm not a very good gambler.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: deciding on treatment chefstill chefstill

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2013 08:18AM chefstill wrote: Thank you so much for getting in touch with me.  Probably like so many of us, I feel kinda alone, but encouraging messages like yours are a wonderful, uplifting help.  I did decide I'm going to go for treatment, and I'll let you know how I'm doing.  I'm so happy to hear you're doing great.  Anytime we can defeat Cancer, it's a big win for us!  Thanks again..All the best
Posts.Title: deciding on treatment chefstill chefstill

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2013 09:12AM chefstill wrote: Thank you, Rose...and amen to the '7 more times'...That made me laugh and goodness knows we need some good laughs along the way.  I'm sure I will be thinking exactly the same thing.  I hope you are finished with chemo now, and enjoying great health.  Have you changed your diet and daily activities?  all the best
